unnormalised: Yo, car fanatics! The auto world's been buzzing with new launches lately!
normalised: Yo, car fanatics! The auto world has been buzzing with new launches lately!

unnormalised: First off, Mahindra dropped the new 'Scorpio N Adventure Edition' just in time for Diwali! It's got all-wheel drive and promises some serious off-roading fun on those Leh-Ladakh trips. Price? Starts around Rs. 18 Lakh.
normalised: First off, Mahindra dropped the new 'Scorpio N Adventure Edition' just in time for Diwali! It has all-wheel drive and promises some serious off-roading fun on those Leh-Ladakh trips. Price? Starts around rupee eighteen lakh.

unnormalised: Then, Tata Motors unveiled its electric 'Punch EV' – a compact SUV targeting the budget-conscious eco-warriors. Dr. Sharma from ARAI says it's got a range of over 350 km on a single charge. Perfect for zipping around Mumbai, avoiding those crazy traffic jams!
normalised: Then, Tata Motors unveiled its electric 'Punch E V' – a compact S U V targeting the budget-conscious eco-warriors. Doctor Sharma from A R A I says it has a range of over three hundred and fifty kilometer on a single charge. Perfect for zipping around Mumbai, avoiding those crazy traffic jams!

unnormalised: Maruti Suzuki isn’t far behind. Rumors are swirling about a new 'Jimny 5-door' variant, bigger than the current model, with more space for the whole family. We hear it'll be showcased at the Auto Expo.
normalised: Maruti Suzuki is not far behind. Rumors are swirling about a new 'Jimny five-door' variant, bigger than the current model, with more space for the whole family. We hear it will be showcased at the Auto Expo.

unnormalised: Plus, that swanky new BMW i7 we saw pics of last month? Yeah, it's officially hit Indian showrooms. Think plush interiors, a theatre screen for the backseat passengers, and a price tag that'll make your jaw drop. We're talking about Rs. 2 Cr plus, folks!
normalised: Plus, that swanky new B M W i seven we saw pictures of last month? Yeah, it is officially hit Indian showrooms. Think plush interiors, a theatre screen for the backseat passengers, and a price tag that will make your jaw drop. We are talking about rupee two crore plus, folks!

unnormalised: And Bajaj launched the 'Chetak 2.0', with a bigger battery and more storage (around 20 sq ft!). Time to ditch that old scooter and go electric, no?
normalised: And Bajaj launched the 'Chetak two point zero', with a bigger battery and more storage (around twenty square feet!). Time to ditch that old scooter and go electric, no?
